author: x10an14
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 and PowerShell 7+ issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6).

-->

## Steps to reproduce

```powershell
[2020-06-29 18:34:29] 0 x10an14@x10-desktop:~
-> $ docker run --rm -it mcr.microsoft.com/powershell pwsh
Unable to find image 'mcr.microsoft.com/powershell:latest' locally
latest: Pulling from powershell
23884877105a: Pull complete
bc38caa0f5b9: Pull complete
2910811b6c42: Pull complete
36505266dcc6: Pull complete
f43b8f1114bc: Pull complete
Digest: sha256:9a141117590e8c7cad2abf42abee5c7a21e466679525c87d7a2455ad7d37e514
Status: Downloaded newer image for mcr.microsoft.com/powershell:latest
PowerShell 7.0.2
Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

https://aka.ms/powershell
Type 'help' to get help.

PS /> $a = [Net.HttpWebRequest]::Create([Uri]::new('https://outlook.com'))
PS /> $a.GetResponse()

IsMutuallyAuthenticated : False
ContentLength           : 26578
ContentType             : text/html; charset=utf-8
ContentEncoding         :
Cookies                 : {}
LastModified            : 6/29/2020 4:35:10 PM
Server                  : Microsoft-IIS/10.0
ProtocolVersion         : 1.1
Headers                 : {Cache-Control, Server, P3P, Set-Cookie…}
Method                  : GET
ResponseUri             : https://login.live.com/login.srf?wa=wsignin1.0&rpsnv=13&ct=1593448510&rver=7.0.6737.0&wp=MBI_SSL&wreply=https%3a%2f%2foutlook.live.com%2fowa%2f%3fRpsCsrfState%3d03aaaf9e-adc8-b1fb-7d53-0c415010703b&id=292841&aadredir=1&CBCXT=out&lw=1&fl=dob%2cflname%2cwld
                          &cobrandid=90015
StatusCode              : OK
StatusDescription       : OK
CharacterSet            : utf-8
SupportsHeaders         : True
IsFromCache             : False

PS /> $b = $a.ServicePoint
PS /> $b.Certificate
PS /> exit
[2020-06-29 18:35:30] 0 x10an14@x10-desktop:~
-> $ pwsh
PowerShell 7.0.2
Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

https://aka.ms/powershell
Type 'help' to get help.

PS /home/x10an14> $a = [Net.HttpWebRequest]::Create([Uri]::new('https://outlook.com'))
PS /home/x10an14> $a.GetResponse()

IsMutuallyAuthenticated : False
ContentLength           : 26580
ContentType             : text/html; charset=utf-8
ContentEncoding         :
Cookies                 : {}
LastModified            : 29/06/2020 18:35:42
Server                  : Microsoft-IIS/10.0
ProtocolVersion         : 1.1
Headers                 : {Cache-Control, Server, P3P, Set-Cookie…}
Method                  : GET
ResponseUri             : https://login.live.com/login.srf?wa=wsignin1.0&rpsnv=13&ct=1593448541&rver=7.0.6737.0&wp=MBI_SSL&wreply=https%3a%2f%2foutlook.live.com%2fowa%2f%3fRpsCsrfState%3d034dd7fd-e6da-d0ee-a0ec-7c095968151f&id=292841&aadredir=1&CBCXT=out&lw=1&fl=dob%2cflname%2cwld
                          &cobrandid=90015
StatusCode              : OK
StatusDescription       : OK
CharacterSet            : utf-8
SupportsHeaders         : True
IsFromCache             : False

PS /home/x10an14> $b = $a.ServicePoint
PS /home/x10an14> $b.Certificate
PS /home/x10an14> date
Mon 29 Jun 18:35:51 CEST 2020
PS /home/x10an14> exit
[2020-06-29 18:35:53] 0 x10an14@x10-desktop:~
-> $ dotnet --info
.NET Core SDK (reflecting any global.json):
 Version:   3.1.301
 Commit:    7feb845744

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     debian
 OS Version:  10
 OS Platform: Linux
 RID:         debian.10-x64
 Base Path:   /usr/share/dotnet/sdk/3.1.301/

Host (useful for support):
  Version: 3.1.5
  Commit:  65cd789777

.NET Core SDKs installed:
  2.2.402 [/usr/share/dotnet/sdk]
  3.0.103 [/usr/share/dotnet/sdk]
  3.1.301 [/usr/share/dotnet/sdk]

.NET Core runtimes installed:
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.All 2.2.8 [/usr/share/dotnet/shared/Microsoft.AspNetCore.All]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 2.2.8 [/usr/share/dotnet/shared/Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 3.0.3 [/usr/share/dotnet/shared/Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 3.1.5 [/usr/share/dotnet/shared/Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 2.2.8 [/usr/share/dotnet/shared/Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 3.0.3 [/usr/share/dotnet/shared/Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 3.1.5 [/usr/share/dotnet/shared/Microsoft.NETCore.App]

To install additional .NET Core runtimes or SDKs:
  https://aka.ms/dotnet-download
[2020-06-29 18:36:08] 0 x10an14@x10-desktop:~
-> $
```

## Expected behavior

That `$b.Certificate` is not null/empty.

## Actual behavior

`$b.Certificate` is empty.

## Environment data

```
[2020-06-29 18:37:59] 0 x10an14@x10-desktop:~
-> $ pwsh
PowerShell 7.0.2
Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

https://aka.ms/powershell
Type 'help' to get help.

PS /home/x10an14> echo $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.2
OS                             Linux 4.19.0-9-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 4.19.118-2+deb10u1 (2020-06-07)
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

PS /home/x10an14> 
```

comments.author: x10an14
x10an14
comments.body:
@n777ty, no I had not! I would agree, closing issue!

Thanks =)

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: PowerShell doesn't use the obsolete API `Net.HttpWebRequest`. It is .Net issue. Please discuss in .Net Runtime repository.

comments.author: x10an14
comments.body: Sorry, I thought "Close and comment" button closed the issue - I didn't double check that it did!

title: Unable to download HTTPs Certificates (as documented in .NET Core 3.1) with PowerShell 7 (Core) on Debian 10/Microsoft's official PowerShell Docker image.
